intro: Ctenodon sabulicola, commonly known as the sand lily, is a flowering plant native to sandy soils in southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and strap-like leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
